flawed_nl_solution:
Boys make up 100% - 60% = 30% of the total number of students.
The total number of students at the school is 300 / (30/100) = <<300/(30/100)=1000>>1000 students.
Since 60% of the students are female, there are (60/100) * 1000 = <<60/100*1000=600>>600 female students.
#### 600

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 40, not 30. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
